content.content: It’s primarily a gas price issue. The concern is that if gas costs are too high then debt auctions will be less attractive if a vault needs to be liquidated. This could result in the protocol losing money. The most recent thread examining this is here:     Gas Environment and Dust Limit Review - August 2021 Risk       Here is an update on the gas market environment and dust parameter (minimum permitted vault debt). I plan to begin posting these updates on a more regular basis to help the community stay aligned on the dust parameter and respond to changing conditions.   EIP 1559 and Gas Market Changes Ethereum recently activated the London hard fork, which initiated EIP 1559. This creates a fairly large change to the gas fee market. Gas fees are now separated into two sections, a base fee and miner tip. The ba…     That said, if the ETH POS merge is successful and gas costs reduce then we may be able to review this. However, there is an uncertaim timeline on this at present.
